page.title: 16Filleigh farms survey
page.content: The people at Torrington put the milk into bottles and send it out. Some is made into butter and cream. The biggest number of sheep on any farm in Filleigh is 200. Other farms in our survey keep 130, 100, 120 and 65 sheep. Some farms just keep sheep in winter. The most popular type of sheep is close wool, including Devon closewool. Other breeds are kept including cheviots. We have one pig farm in our area which has four hundred pigs on it. All the farms in our survey have at least one cat. Some have even eleven cats on their farms. Not all farms have dogs but most do. Dogs are kept for different things. Some dogs are used for rounding up sheep and cows and some are kept as pets.
